poem:
In the Shadow of Blue Lights  

The streets wear their own kind of silence,  
doors close like tired books, unread.  
Numbers, neat on a page whisper  
of sirens fading into indifference.  
Here, where echoes fail to return  
and justice sleeps,  
a map of unsolved crimes unfolds  
like tangled thread,  
each line leading nowhere,  
yet all pointing towards our shared forgetting.
